sentences.en: "[The photos are] repugnant to us as human beings and contrary to the standards and values of the United States army," the statement said.
sentences.cn: 声明中说，“这些照片违背了美国军队的准则和价值观，也让同为人类一员的我们感到恶心”。

sentences.en: All food was repugnant to me during my illness.
sentences.cn: 生病时所有的食物都使我感到厌恶.

sentences.en: Darwinism is naturally repugnant to leftwing thought.
sentences.cn: 达尔文主义同左翼思想自然是格格不入的.

sentences.en: Everything about the affair was repugnant to her.
sentences.cn: 有关那件事的一切令她反感。

sentences.en: Here is a stagnation that is repugnant.
I cannot do it in that way. It is repugnant to me.
sentences.cn: 我不能干这种事儿. 这和我的性格为人是不一致的.

sentences.en: I have never beaten my wife and never will. I find assault of others completely repugnant, and assault of women especially so.
sentences.cn: 我从没有也永远不会打我的妻子，我认为殴打他人的人非常令人反感，尤其是打女人。

sentences.en: It is repugnant to me even to speak to him.
sentences.cn: 我甚至连和他说话都感到讨厌.

sentences.en: It was repugnant to me to talk about Sebastian to Mr. Samgrass.
sentences.cn: 和桑格拉斯先生谈论塞巴斯蒂安是非常令我反感的.

sentences.en: Nothing could have been more repugnant to him.
Of course the idea of the U.S. government "owning" every single asset of the American people is repugnant to our entire way of life, but let's assume that for a moment.
sentences.cn: 当然美国政府“拥有”美国人民的每一份财产的这个想法是让人恶心的，与我们整个的生活方式完全相反，不过让我们假设一下那种情况。

sentences.en: The Committee said his actions were improper and repugnant.
sentences.cn: 委员会称他行为失当，令人反感。

sentences.en: The idea of accepting a bribe was repugnant to me.
sentences.cn: 我一想到受贿这种事就非常反感.

sentences.en: The idea was repugnant to him.
The mere idea of stealing had been repugnant.
sentences.cn: 光是偷盗这种想法就很令人反感.

sentences.en: The odour of vitamin in skin is repugnant to insects.
sentences.cn: 昆虫很讨厌皮肤内维生素的气味。

sentences.en: This neglect of religious observances was repugnant to her early traditions.
sentences.cn: 忽视宗教仪式是违反她童年时期的教养的.

sentences.en: We found his suggestion absolutely repugnant.
sentences.cn: 我们觉得他的建议绝对不得人心。
